Elisabeth E, Marshall
Division of Radio & Television
Board of Education
228 North LaSalle Street
Chicago 1, Illinois
Dear Lis,
lour very disturbing letter of March 10 sits before roe.
I had begun to think that I had a corner on weird situations.
I can sympathize (for whatever little good that will do) with
your situation. I "enjoyed" a similar frustration in Saint
Louis. It is maddening to sit day after day eager to do things
that mast be done and have your hands tied.
I have studied the cold calculated answer to my original
request. I cannot see how I can contact anyone about this re¬
quest. We can only hope for the best. There is an outside
chance that the material, when and if it Is produced, will fit
in with our committee plans, hut this is not too likely.
We may have to struggle along without Chicago*s help# I
know we have your help, but I*m afraid we are only making your
position untenable.
Sometime the first of April * will be going through Chicago
and I will try once more to meet with Mr. Jennings. I will keep
you informed on of my plans.
Incidently, during the Cincinnati convention of the DAVI,
Dr. Philip Lewis and I had the opportunity to talk about these
Utilization materials. He is a member of the DAVI Television
Committee and a member of the Television Sub-committee of the
American Association of Colleges of Teacher*s Education. Both
groups are interested in the Utilization problem and from the
enclosed memo you can see what they have in mind. I asked Dr.
